data.title: Television This Week
data.text:
Today

8 P.M. (2) THE 200th EPISODE CELEBRATION OF ‘ALL IN THE FAMILY.’ A 90‐minute special featuring segments from past episodes of the popular comedy series; Norman Lear is the host.

8 (7) “THE ORDEAL OF PATTY HEARST.” A three‐hour made‐for‐TV dramatization of the 1974 kidnapping and search for the heiress told from the point of view of Special Agent Charles Bates who was in charge of the F.B.I.'s San Francisco Bureau at the time; Starring Lisa Eilbacher and Dennis Weaver.

8(13) “LAST STAND IN EDEN.” A National Geographic Special that focuses on the plight of wild elephants in Kenya that are being forced out of their habitats as cities and farms expand; ‘Alexander Scourby is the narrator.

9:30 (2) “JUST FRIENDS.” A new weekly situation comedy series starring Stockard Channing as a divorcée who starts a new life in Los Angeles as the manager of a health club. (See Martin Kasindorf's article on page. 33.)

10 (2) “THE MARY TYLER MOORE HOUR.” The premiere of a situation comedy‐variety series about a television star and her problems at home and on the job; Lucille Ball and Mike Douglas are the guests.

Monday

9 P.M. (4) “JENNIFER': A WOMAN'S STORY.” A made‐for‐TV movie starring Elizabeth Montgomery as a widow involved in a power struggle for control of her late husband's company; With Bradford Dillman and Scott Hylands.

11:15 (13) THE DICK CAVETT SHOW. The first installment in a week‐long rebroadcast of Mr. Cavett's 1973 interview with Katharine Hepburn.

Tuesday

8 P.M. (2) “INSIDE THE UNION.” A “CBS Reports” news special focusing on the struggles in Indiana between dissidents and regular members of Local 1010 of the United Steelworkers Union.

Wednesday

4:30 P.M. (7) “THE TERRIBLE SECRET.” An “Afterschool Special” about a teen‐ager involved in an auto accident.

8 (13) . GREAT PERFORMANCES. “Choreography by Balanchine, Part 4.” A performance of five ballets by George Balanchine, adapted especially for television, and starring Mikhail Baryshnikov, Patricia McBride, Peter Martins and Suzanne Farrell.

1 (4) “STUDS LONIGAN.” The first installment in a three‐part adaptation of James T. Farrell's novel of life in post‐World War‐I Chicago; Starring Harry Hamlin, Charles Durning, Colleen Dewhurst and Lisa Pelikan.

Friday

9 P.M. (7) “THE CHILD STEALER.” A two‐hour made‐for‐TV movie about a woman's search for her daughters who have been kidnapped by her exhusband; starring Beau Bridges and Blair Brown.

Saturday

7:30 P.M. (7) “CANCER: UNWANTED FRINGE BENEFIT.” A report on the increase in industrial cancer in the United States and the high cancer death rate in New Jersey.

8 (13) “THAT GREAT AMERICAN GOSPEL SOUND.” A two‐hour gospel music concert recorded at the Grand Ole Opry house in Nashville.

Channel 41 (WXTV) — Paterson, N.J. Spanish films, serials, news, sports. Weekdays from 2 P.M., and Saturday and Sunday from 11 A.M

Channel 47 (WNJU) ‐ Newark, N. J. Mostly serials and variety programs in Spanish and Italian. Weekdays from 4:30 P.M., Saturday from 2:30 P.M., Sunday from 2 P.M.

Channel 50 (WNJM) — Little Falls, N.J. New Jersey Public Broadcasting. Mostly local New Jersey news, sports, PBS programs.

Weekdays from 9 A.M., Saturday arid Sunday from 5 P.M.

Channel 60,68 (WTVG)—West Orange, N.J. Pay television after 8 P.M. Variety, children's, financial, ethnic and sports programs. Weekdays and Saturday from 7:15 A.M. and Sunday from 6:45 A.M.

Details received too late for this schedule are on the Weather Page in today's main news section.
